conclusion: The track from A to B is the upper half of a circle of radius R = 1 m.
The track from B to C is the lower half of another circle of the same radius.
The straight line AB is therefore the diameter of the first circle (length 2R = 2 m).
The straight line BC is the diameter of the second circle (also 2 m).
A, B and C all lie on the same horizontal line.

premise: Horizontal component: AB + BC = 2 m + 2 m = 4 m to the East. Vertical component: zero (the particle starts and ends on the same horizontal line).
conclusion: Magnitude of displacement |Δr| = √[(4 m)² + 0²] = 4 m. Direction: due East.

premise: Length of one semicircle: (½)(2πR) = πR = π(1 m) = π m.
v̅ = Δr / Δt = (4 m East) / (5 s)
conclusion: Magnitude: |v̅| = 4 m / 5 s = 0.8 m s⁻¹. Direction: East.

premise: v_av = total distance / Δt = (2π m) / (5 s)
Average velocity: 0.8 m s⁻¹ toward the East. Average speed: (2π/5) m s⁻¹ ≈ 1.26 m s⁻¹.
conclusion: Final answer: Average velocity: 0.8 m/s, Average speed: 1.256 m/s.
